## Purpose
Rich library emoji rendering component that provides emoji support for console output, including Unicode emoji lookup, text replacement, and rich console integration.

## Key Components

### Emoji Class (L27-78)
Primary emoji representation class inheriting from JupyterMixin for Jupyter notebook compatibility.

**Attributes (L28):**
- `name`: Emoji name identifier
- `style`: Rich Style object or string for styling
- `_char`: Resolved Unicode character(s)
- `variant`: Text or emoji variant selector

**Key Methods:**
- `__init__(L32-55)`: Validates emoji name against EMOJI dict, raises NoEmoji if not found, applies variant selectors
- `replace(L57-67)`: Class method for bulk emoji code replacement in text using `_emoji_replace`
- `__rich_console__(L75-78)`: Rich protocol implementation yielding styled Segment

**VARIANTS (L30):** Unicode variation selectors for text (\uFE0E) vs emoji (\uFE0F) rendering

### Exception Classes
- `NoEmoji(L23-24)`: Raised when emoji name lookup fails

### Type Definitions
- `EmojiVariant(L20)`: Literal type constraining variants to "emoji" or "text"

## Dependencies
- `._emoji_codes.EMOJI`: Master emoji name-to-unicode mapping dict
- `._emoji_replace._emoji_replace`: Text processing function for :emoji_name: syntax
- `.segment.Segment`: Rich rendering primitive
- `.style.Style`: Rich styling system
- `.jupyter.JupyterMixin`: Jupyter display integration

## Architecture Patterns
- Rich protocol compliance via `__rich_console__` method
- Slot-based optimization for memory efficiency
- Class method for static text processing
- Variant selector pattern for emoji/text rendering modes

## Demo Script (L81-96)
Development utility displaying all available emojis in columns, with optional HTML export capability. Filters out complex emojis containing zero-width joiners (\u200D).
